author: UNG Sports Communications
title: UNG women's soccer overpowers Motevallo, 4-1
text:
Thursday October 8th, 2015 12:38AM Posted 11:08PM on Wednesday 7th October 2015 ( 1 hour ago ) UNG women's soccer overpowers Motevallo, 4-1 By UNG Sports Communications Related Articles No. 2 Nighthawks erase two-goal deficit, down Lenoir-Rhyne, 3-2 UNG's Sayre honored as Peach Belt Conference Goalkeeper of the Week Sayre honored as PBC Goalkeeper of the Week Jacy Ramey named UNG Campus Cash Nighthawk of the Week 
MONTEVALLO, Ala. — A trio of late goals pushed the No. 2-ranked University of North Georgia women's soccer team to a 4-1 Peach Belt Conference win at Montevallo on Wednesday evening at UM's Varsity Field. 
After the host Falcons evened up the match at a goal apiece in the 67th minute, the Nighthawks responded to jump back ahead just a minute later on a goal by Jessica Allen. 
North Georgia (8-0-1, 3-0-1 PBC) tacked on a pair of goals in the final 10 minutes to secure the team's eighth win of the season and extend the season's unbeaten streak to nine matches. 
Montevallo falls to 1-7-2 overall and 0-4-0 in league play. Associated Tags : UNG women's soccer, college soccer © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
